trans-unit.source: An architectural overview of Service Fabric's Resource Balancer
trans-unit.target: An architectural overview of Service Fabric's Resource Balancer

trans-unit.source: The Service Fabric Resource Balancer consists of a single centralized Resource Balancing service and a component that exists on every node, which are conceptually collocated with the Service Fabric Failover Manager and with the local Service Fabric node, respectively.
trans-unit.target: The Service Fabric Resource Balancer consists of a single centralized Resource Balancing service and a component that exists on every node, which are conceptually collocated with the Service Fabric Failover Manager and with the local Service Fabric node, respectively.

trans-unit.source: The local agent is responsible for collecting and buffering load reports from the services that are running on the local node, for sending them to the Resource Balancer service, and also for reporting failures and other events to the Failover Manager and Resource Balancer (1 and 2 above).
trans-unit.target: The local agent is responsible for collecting and buffering load reports from the services that are running on the local node, for sending them to the Resource Balancer service, and also for reporting failures and other events to the Failover Manager and Resource Balancer (1 and 2 above).

trans-unit.source: The Resource Balancer service and the Failover Manager collaborate to respond to load events and other events in the system, such as replica or node failures, load reports, and services and applications that are created and deleted.
trans-unit.target: The Resource Balancer service and the Failover Manager collaborate to respond to load events and other events in the system, such as replica or node failures, load reports, and services and applications that are created and deleted.

trans-unit.source: For example, when a replica fails, the Failover Manager requests that the Service Fabric Resource Balancer suggest a location for the replacement that is based on load data from the different nodes.
trans-unit.target: For example, when a replica fails, the Failover Manager requests that the Service Fabric Resource Balancer suggest a location for the replacement that is based on load data from the different nodes.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, when a new service request is received, the Failover Manager requests recommendations from the Resource Balancer for where to place that service.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, when a new service request is received, the Failover Manager requests recommendations from the Resource Balancer for where to place that service.

trans-unit.source: In all these cases, the Resource Balancer responds with changes to various service configurations (3), which are then enacted by the Failover Manager.
trans-unit.target: In all these cases, the Resource Balancer responds with changes to various service configurations (3), which are then enacted by the Failover Manager.
